{"step_by_step_thinking": "Schielder principle is a concept in endodontics that refers to the preservation of the original shape and contour of the root canal during the cleaning and shaping process. It emphasizes that the original canal curvature should not be altered and the apical foramen should not be enlarged excessively. Therefore, the options about changing the shape of the canal or enlarging the apical foramen do not align with this principle.", "answer_choice": "D. Original canal curvature should be altered to make it compatible with obturating material"}
